block.p: Laura Katherine Eanes and Richard McFall Martin, teachers at Blair Academy in Blairstown, N.J., were married yesterday at the First Congregational Church in Washington, Conn. The Rev. Richard Moore, an uncle of the bride and a Presbyterian minister, performed the ceremony.
The bride teaches mathematics and coaches junior varsity tennis and lacrosse. The bridegroom teaches English and coaches varsity football and baseball.

Laura Katherine Eanes and Richard McFall Martin, teachers at Blair Academy in Blairstown, N.J., were married yesterday at the First Congregational Church in Washington, Conn. The Rev. Richard Moore, an uncle of the bride and a Presbyterian minister, performed the ceremony.
The bride teaches mathematics and coaches junior varsity tennis and lacrosse. The bridegroom teaches English and coaches varsity football and baseball.
Mrs. Martin, 27, graduated from Colby College and expects to receive a master's degree in mathematics education from Columbia University Teachers College in September.

She is the daughter of Susan F. Eanes and Michael N. Eanes of Litchfield, Conn. From 1979 to 1991, her father was the headmaster of the Gunnery, the prep school in Washington, Conn. He is now the executive director of the American Montessori Society in New York. Her mother was until earlier this month the director of development and admissions at the Town Hill School in Lakeville, Conn.
Mr. Martin, 32, graduated from Kenyon College and is a candidate for a master's degree in English from Middlebury College.

He is the son of Nancy Shilts of Pleasant Ridge, Mich., and Christopher B. Martin of Charlotte, N.C. His mother is an associate general counsel at the Federal-Mogul Corporation, an automotive parts supplier in Southfield, Mich. His father teaches English at Charlotte Country Day School. The bridegroom is the stepson of John A. Shilts.
